page.title: 05Wildlife around Newton Pop.
page.content: The countryside around Newton Poppleford provides habitation for a variety of wildlife.In a field we saw a Rabbit and Blackbirds playing around some Poppies.Just up the road was a big patch of Cow Parsley.As we stopped for a rest by the river Otter we saw a House Martin swoop over the river. Also there was a metal grid with the holes blocked by mud and reeds and inside this pulp was a Willow Warbler's nest.Along the railway we saw some Pink Campion,Wild Strawberry Plants,a Goats Beard plant,Blackberry bushes,Thistles,Rayless Maywed and plenty of Stinging Nettles!There are plenty of Minnows and a few Trout in the river and Pennywort and Foxgloves grow along the banks.
